headline: We Could Have A Clear Shot To 6,000, But Be Proactive

headline: Apple (NasdaqGS:AAPL) New Product Launch Fails To Prevent 11% Share Price Dip
summary: Apple (NasdaqGS:AAPL) launched new products including the MacBook Air and Mac Studio, aiming to capitalize on the enhanced capabilities of its M3 and M4 chips. Despite these advancements, Apple saw a 10.7% decline in its share price over the past week. This movement is notable given that the broader market faced a downturn as well, with major indices like the Nasdaq falling for the fourth consecutive week. Apple's recent corporate developments, such as its substantial U.S. investment plans...

headline: Big Tech Stocks at Cheapest In Months Fail to Entice Wary Buyers
summary: (Bloomberg) -- In the recent market selloff, the valuations of big technology companies have fallen from the lofty heights. Many traders, though, are betting that the declines may well have further to go, and recent history offers evidence to back them up. headline: NASDAQ Correction: 2 AI Stocks That Aren't Worth Buying on the Dip
summary: Two stocks that I'm still not buying even after the sell-off are Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR).  Apple is one of the most recognizable consumer brands in the world and built a strong ecosystem around its iPhones.  Although Apple's revenue is trending in the right direction, it's only projected to grow revenue by a mere 4.6% in fiscal year 2025 (ending around September 30).
